title: Precision Equipment Coatings
description: Previously Precision Collision Repair, this is the new and improved website brought into a more modern era while still keeping the same feel and look. I built this using NextJS, Tailwindcss, React, Typescript, and Contentful to allow the customer to keep the data up to date as they need without waiting for me to make any changes.

title: Cup o' tal
description: A website I am currently developing that will be used for a friend's new coffee shop. This is an example of using CMS to allow the customer to keep the data up to date as they need without waiting for me to make any changes.

title: This.Website
description: This is my replacement for my previous personal website. I have worked on a few react apps but this is the first time I have delved into fully building it myself from the ground up. I have built it with Next.JS and am deploying it with Vercel currently but plan to migrate to netlify.

title: Job Estimator
description: I created this website for my dad to enable him to build out and track job estimates from the ground up. It allows for work items to be defined with an average time requirement and also allows for overrides when unexpected circumstances arise.

title: Mclain.de
description: One of the many iterations of my personal website. I began it in 2018, building on my experience at Tyler Technologies. It is built using ASP.Net MVC with cshtml, JS/JQuery, CSS with an Entity Framework code first SQL database for authentication and data.

title: Celebration At Theos
description: My friends and I entered into a 48 hour game jam with the theme of celebration. We ended up coming up with this idea for a cat trying to gather items for a party with their fellow cat friends. Theo the cat has to avoid his owners while grabbing everything and bringing it to his cat bed in preparation for the party.

title: Ninja Runner
description: This is a small, mobile friendly game I developed during my internship at the CI2 lab. The user has to dodge the incoming bouncing balls to keep their life above 0 for as long as possible. If they allow the green balls to hit them, they will gain health back.

title: King and Country
description: During an internship at the CI2 lab on the USM campus while attending college, I built this little medieval simulation game. It is a top down view of a group of settlers who require direction. You are able to command them to: build structures, cut down trees, hunt and much more all while they have a need for sleep, water, and hunger. This is where I learned so much about C# and Unity, and was how I was able to launch myself into ASP.Net at Tyler Technologies.
